faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.question1: Am I a good candidate for LASIK?
faq.answer1: Good candidates for LASIK are typically 18 years or older with stable vision for at least one year. A comprehensive eye exam during your consultation will determine if LASIK is right for you based on your eye health, prescription, and corneal thickness.
faq.answer2: LASIK is generally not painful. We use numbing eye drops before the procedure, and patients typically feel only slight pressure during the brief surgery. Some mild discomfort, irritation, or dryness may occur during the first 24-48 hours of recovery.
faq.answer3: Most patients notice improved vision immediately after surgery, with vision continuing to stabilize over the next few days. Many return to work within 1-2 days. Complete healing may take 3-6 months, though most visual stabilization occurs within the first few weeks.
faq.answer4: The cost of LASIK at Vision Clarity Institute ranges from $1,800 to $2,500 per eye, depending on your specific vision needs and the technology selected. We offer flexible financing options with affordable monthly payments.

traditional.title: Traditional LASIK
traditional.description: Traditional LASIK is our standard laser vision correction procedure that has helped millions of people worldwide reduce or eliminate their dependence on glasses and contacts.
traditional.how_works_text: During traditional LASIK, our surgeon uses a microkeratome (surgical blade) to create a thin flap in the cornea. The flap is then lifted, and an excimer laser reshapes the corneal tissue underneath to correct your vision. The flap is then repositioned to serve as a natural bandage while healing occurs.
traditional.candidates_text: You may be a good candidate for traditional LASIK if you:

candidates.item1: Are at least 18 years of age
candidates.item2: Have stable vision for at least one year
candidates.item3: Have moderate nearsightedness, farsightedness, or astigmatism
candidates.item5: Have no significant eye health issues

traditional.recovery_text: Most patients experience improved vision within 24 hours after surgery. Full recovery typically takes 1-2 weeks, with stable vision usually achieved within one month. Traditional LASIK has a high success rate, with approximately 96% of patients achieving their desired vision.

custom.title: Custom Bladeless LASIK
custom.description: Custom Bladeless LASIK is our premium, all-laser LASIK procedure that offers enhanced precision and personalization for optimal visual outcomes.
custom.how_works_text: In Custom Bladeless LASIK, we use two different lasers: a femtosecond laser to create the corneal flap (instead of a blade), and an advanced wavefront-guided excimer laser for corneal reshaping. This all-laser approach allows for more precise flap creation and customized treatment based on your unique corneal map.

benefits.item2: Personalized treatment plan based on unique eye characteristics
benefits.item3: Improved night vision and reduced glare compared to traditional LASIK
benefits.item4: Potential to correct higher-order aberrations (visual distortions)
benefits.item5: Excellent option for patients with thin corneas or higher prescriptions

custom.right_for_you_title: Is Custom Bladeless LASIK Right for You?
custom.right_for_you_text: While slightly more expensive than traditional LASIK, Custom Bladeless LASIK may be worth considering if you have complex vision issues, high-order aberrations, or want the most advanced technology available. Our surgeons will assess your specific needs during your consultation.

prk.title: PRK (Photorefractive Keratectomy)
prk.description: PRK is an excellent alternative to LASIK for patients who may not be ideal candidates for flap-based procedures. PRK was the first laser vision correction procedure and continues to offer excellent outcomes.
prk.how_works_text: During PRK, the surgeon gently removes the outer layer of the cornea (epithelium) instead of creating a flap. An excimer laser then reshapes the cornea to correct your vision. The epithelium naturally regenerates within a few days after the procedure.
prk.candidates_text: PRK may be recommended for patients who:

candidates.item1: Have thin corneas that may not be suitable for LASIK
candidates.item2: Have professions or hobbies with higher risk for eye injury (military, contact sports)
candidates.item4: Previously had LASIK and need enhancement

prk.recovery_text: Recovery from PRK takes longer than LASIK, with full visual stabilization typically occurring within 1-3 months. However, the long-term results are comparable to LASIK, and PRK eliminates flap-related complications.

presbyopia.title: Presbyopia Correction
presbyopia.description: Presbyopia is an age-related condition that affects nearly everyone over 40, making it difficult to focus on close objects. At Vision Clarity Institute, we offer several solutions to address presbyopia.
presbyopia.monovision_text: In this approach, one eye is corrected for distance vision and the other for near vision. Your brain learns to use the appropriate eye depending on what you're looking at. This can reduce or eliminate the need for reading glasses.
presbyopia.multifocal_text: Using advanced laser technology, we can create multiple focus zones on your cornea, allowing clear vision at various distances. This advanced technique can provide excellent results for appropriate candidates.
presbyopia.rle_text: For some patients, especially those over 50, replacing the eye's natural lens with an advanced multifocal lens implant may be the best option. This procedure is similar to cataract surgery but is performed before cataracts develop.
presbyopia.determination_title: Determining the Right Option for You
presbyopia.determination_text: During your consultation, our specialists will evaluate your vision, discuss your lifestyle and visual needs, and recommend the most suitable presbyopia correction approach for you.

overview.title: Cutting-Edge Vision Correction Technology
overview.paragraph1: At Vision Clarity Institute, we're committed to providing patients with the most advanced technological solutions for laser vision correction. Our investment in state-of-the-art equipment ensures that you receive the safest, most precise, and effective treatment possible.
overview.paragraph2: Our ophthalmologists are highly trained in using these advanced systems and stay at the forefront of technological innovations through continuous education and training.
overview.paragraph3: From comprehensive diagnostic equipment to precision laser systems, every aspect of our technology is designed to optimize your visual outcomes.

diagnostic.title: Diagnostic Technology
diagnostic.subtitle: Precision mapping and analysis for personalized treatment plans

wavefront.title: Wavefront Analyzer
wavefront.description: Our advanced wavefront technology creates a detailed 3D map of your eye's unique optical system, measuring and identifying even the most subtle vision imperfections that traditional methods might miss. This allows for completely personalized treatments that address your specific visual needs.

topographer.title: Corneal Topographer
topographer.description: This sophisticated imaging system maps the exact shape and curvature of your cornea with microscopic precision. By analyzing the corneal surface, we can identify irregularities and ensure optimal treatment planning, especially important for patients with astigmatism or unusual corneal conditions.

oct.title: Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT)
oct.description: Our OCT system provides ultra-high resolution cross-sectional imaging of your cornea and retina. This non-invasive technology allows us to visualize the distinct layers of your eye to precisely measure corneal thickness and detect any abnormalities that might affect your treatment plan.

laser.title: Laser Technology
laser.subtitle: Precision instruments for optimal vision correction

femtosecond.title: Femtosecond Laser
femtosecond.description: Used in our bladeless LASIK procedures, this ultra-fast laser creates precise corneal flaps with accuracy measured in microns. The femtosecond laser produces extremely short pulses of energy, allowing for incredibly precise tissue separation without generating heat, resulting in more consistent flap thickness and reduced complications.

excimer.title: Wavefront-Guided Excimer Laser
excimer.description: Our advanced excimer laser system reshapes your cornea with extreme precision to correct your vision. Integrated with wavefront technology, the laser treatment is customized to your unique visual profile. The system features high-speed eye tracking that adjusts for even the smallest eye movements during the procedure, ensuring perfect alignment.

eyetracking.title: Advanced Eye Tracking System
eyetracking.description: Our laser systems incorporate sophisticated eye-tracking technology that monitors your eye position more than 1,000 times per second. This ensures that the laser treatment remains perfectly centered even with microscopic eye movements, delivering consistent results and enhancing safety throughout the procedure.
